markdown.markdown:
![](images/profile.jpg){width="160" style="border-radius:50%;float:left;margin-right:20px;margin-bottom:10px;"} ::: intro-block **Jesús Cáceres Tello** is a computer scientist and educator with extensive experience in ICT, higher education, and applied research in environmental informatics and educational innovation.\ He holds a **Diploma in Computer Science** from the University of Málaga, a **B.Sc. in Computer Engineering** from the Catholic University of Ávila, and a **Master’s degree in Educational Informatics** from the University of Alcalá. He is currently pursuing his **Ph.D. at the Faculty of Statistical Studies, Complutense University of Madrid**. Throughout his professional career, Jesús has held several positions of responsibility in public institutions.\ At the **University of Alcalá**, he led the design, maintenance, and digital identity of the university’s web platforms.\ At the **Carlos III Health Institute**, he contributed to European projects on **Electronic Health Records (EHR)**, **semantic interoperability**, and **telemedicine** under ISO 13606 and ISO 21090 standards.\ He also worked at the **Spanish Ministry of Education** developing national e-learning platforms.\ Since 2014, he has served at the **Madrid City Council**, leading technological projects and training initiatives within the Environmental Department. Jesús has been a **lecturer for more than a decade**, teaching at both undergraduate and master’s levels. He is currently part of academic innovation groups promoting open and collaborative learning and a member of the **ACM Spain SIGCSE Chapter** and the **EN13606 Association**. His current interests combine **technology, sustainability, and education**, fostering **data-driven innovation** and **scientific literacy** in the digital era. ::: # 🔬 Research & Teaching Areas - 🌍 Environmental data modelling and air quality forecasting\ - 🤖 Machine learning and hybrid predictive models (Prophet–LSTM, GAT–BiLSTM)\ - 🧠 Quantum computing for education\ - 🧩 STEM education and open pedagogy\ - 📈 Open science and reproducible research\ - 🪶 Data visualisation and scientific communication # 📚 Publications & Open Repositories ```{=html}
🎓 Citizen Science and STEM Education with R

Reproducible learning from open urban air and meteorological data (Madrid, 2020–2024)

🌍 Open Project Page 📄 Article (PDF) 💻 Notebook 💾 Repository

🌱 Behavioural and Institutional Drivers of Green Technology Adoption

A TAM-based framework for sustainability transitions (Frontiers in Psychology, 2025)

📄 Article 💻 Repository 📘 README

``` # 🧑‍🎓 Professional Profiles You can explore my professional and academic presence across several open-science platforms. These profiles provide access to publications, collaborations, datasets, and teaching activities related to environmental informatics, STEM education, and open data research. Connect with me on: ```{=html}
```
